main event: An observation of a low altitude object, possibly a balloon, was recorded in Waterville, Minnesota on July 12, 1954.
interesting points: The object appeared to be 1.2 inches in diameter and orange in color,The observation lasted for 3 minutes,The object was passing from northwest to southeast at an altitude of 12,000 feet,It was reported that similar sightings occurred in the area at the same time,The weather conditions were clear with very high clouds present.
sighted object: a low altitude object, possibly a balloon
